intro: Papaver nudicaule var. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered poppy, is a variant of the meadow poppy. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, characterized by its delicate, papery petals that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces showy, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, and it thrives in well-drained, sunny soils. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
